Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Membro dell' editorial board della rivista "The International Spectator": http://www.tandfonline.com/action/journa lInformation?show=editorialBoard&journal Code=rspe20
Membro dell'Editorial Board della rivista "Journal of Immigrant & Refugee Studies": http://www.tandfonline.com/action/journa lInformation?show=editorialBoard&journal Code=wimm20

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: “On EU Circular Migration Schemes: The issue of return and reintegration of temporary migrant workers”. Paper presented at conference on “Social Security and Labour Mobility in the Enlarged EU”, organised by Fudan University, Shanghai, China.

“Rethinking Conceptual Approaches to Return Migration”. Paper presented at the international conference on “Return Migration in Asia” organised by the National University of Singapore and the Asia Research Institute (ARI), Singapore.

“State-to-state Cooperation on the Readmission of Unauthorized Migrants”. Lecture at the Chevening Programme organized by the Foreign and Common Wealth Office of the United Kingdom, London, United Kingdom.

“Resilient Bilateralism in the Cooperation on Readmission”. Paper presented at the workshop on “The External Dimension of the Area of Freedom, Security and Justice (AFSJ): Challenges and opportunities” organised by the Academy of European Law at the European University Institute, Florence, Italy.
“Thinking Differently: Civil Society Organizations’ alternative contribution to global processes”. Lecture at the Global Forum on Migration and Development (GFMD) in Athens, Greece.
“Cooperazione in materia di riammissione nell’area euro-mediterranea”. Lecture at the Department of Political Science, University of Milan, Milan, Italy.
“Beyond Asymmetries”. Paper presented at the 12th Biennial EUSA conference, Boston, Massachusetts, USA.
Keynote speaker at the International conference organised by the Department of Anthropology at the University of Trier and entitled “The Resilience of People in Motion”, Trier, Germany.

Annual conference of the European Union Institute for Security Studies (EUISS) in Paris, France. Participated in the Working Group on “the socioeconomic dimension of the Arab Spring: The Human-side effect”. French Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Paris, France.

Keynote speaker at the Conference organized by the Danish Institute for International Studies (DIIS) on “Border and mobility dynamics: Reconfiguring borders and mobility in times of crisis“. Title: “Through the looking-glass of readmission: The drive for securitized circularity”, Copenhagen, Denmark.
“Tunisia’s New Drivers in Migration Governance”. Paper presented at the 2013 Annual Convention of the International Studies Association, San Francisco, California, USA.
“Labour and the EU Readmission System”. Paper presented at the 13th Biennial EUSA conference, Baltimore, Maryland, USA.
Invited speaker by the European Parliament for a public hearing on “EU Readmission Agreements and their Implications for Human Rights Observance”, Brussels, Belgium
“Migration Instruments: Insights from EU External Relations.” Conference co-organized by Queen Mary University and the University of Vienna, London, United Kingdom.
“Conditions of Return Migrants: Reintegration and Development”. Conference organised by the European University Institute, in the framework of the CRIS project. Florence, Italy.
“La migration temporaire des Maghrébins en Europe. Enjeux actuels et conséquences sur leur réinsertion au pays”. Paper presented at the conference organised by INSEA, Rabat, Morocco.

“Methodological challenges for the study of return and circular migration”. Paper presented at the conference organised in the framework of the TEMPER Project (7th FP), University of Madrid, Madrid, Spain.
“Approaching Borders and Frontiers in a Comparative Perspective”. Paper presented at the Congress of the European International Studies Association (EISA), Catania, Italy.

“Variabilité des transferts de politiques migratoires en Méditerranée”. Paper presented at the conference entitled "Frontières, sociétés et droit en mouvement", organised by the Maison Méditerranéenne des Sciences de l’Homme (MMSH), Aix-en-Provence, France.
“Border, Mobility and Power in Tunisia before and after 2011”. Paper presented at the 18th Congress of the Italian Society for Middle Eastern Studies (Sesamo), Catania, Italy.
“Making Migration Control Visible and Intelligible”. Paper presented at the international conference organised by the Free University of Brussels (ULB), Brussels, Belgium.
“Visualizing the Expansion of the EU Readmission System”. Presentation at the SOPEMI Migration Expert Group of the OECD, Paris.

“The EU Readmission System: A new Analytical Perspective.” Presentation done in the framework of the seminar series entitled “Europe and the Refugee Situation: Security, Politics and Human Consequences“ organized by the Danish Institute for International Studies (DIIS), Copenhagen, Denmark.

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Direttore e coordinatore di ricerca presso l'Istituto Universitario Europeo del progetto "Cross-Regional Information System on the Reintegration of Migration in their Countries of Origin (CRIS)" finanziato dall'Agenzia Svizzera per lo Sviluppo e la Cooperazione, su una durata di 42 mesi. Veda: http://rsc.eui.eu/RDP/research-projects/cris/ Contratto n. 81013214. Ammontare: 746,000 Euros

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Co-relatore della tesi di dottorato di Katie Kuschminder, intitolata “Female Return Migration and Reintegration Strategies in Ethiopia.” La tesi fu discussa il 10 settembre 2014 presso l'Università di Maastricht (Olanda).

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Jean Monnet Fellow presso il Centro Robert Schuman dell'Istituto Universitario Europeo, Firenze.
Research Fellow presso il Centro Robert Schuman dell'Istituto Universitario Europeo, Firenze
Research Fellow presso il Centro Robert Schuman dell'Istituto Universitario Europeo, Firenze. Progetto BORDERLANDS, Progetto ERC.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Direttore e coordinatore del progetto "Migrazione di Ritorno nel Maghreb" (progetto MIREM), basato presso l'Istituto Universitario Europeo (Firenze) e finanziato dalla Commissione europea, contratto numero: MIGR/2005/103-626. Il progetto era di una durata di 36 mesi con un finanziamento da 1,076,000 Euros. Veda: http://rsc.eui.eu/RDP/research-projects/mirem/
